meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -! Welcome to my groovy review of The Settlers: New Allies, where I'll be diving into the world of city-building and war-waging without getting too bogged down in the negativity (mostly) from other critics.

As I played through this game, I couldn't help but feel like I was trying to fit a square peg into a round hole. The classic gameplay of The Settlers series seems to have been mashed together with real-time strategy elements, resulting in a game that feels... well, let's just say it's not exactly the most thrilling experience.

Some critics might say this game is a slow-paced and overly simplistic take on city building and war waging. I mean, what even is the fun in building a city if you're not gonna have to worry about pesky things like resource management or defense from those pesky barbarians?

But hey, at least the wholesome looks and relaxing atmosphere are on point! That's what I'm saying when I read that PC Gamer guy's review. "Wholesome" is exactly the vibe I got while playing this game. It's like having a nice cup of tea with your favorite grandma, minus the awkward small talk.

Now, where some critics went wrong (in my humble opinion) is in expecting The Settlers: New Allies to be something it's not. IGN Italia said it tries to reinvent the series, but I think that's just giving it too much credit. It's like trying to put a square peg into... well, you get it.

And don't even get me started on GameStar's "New Alliances demolishes everything the series has previously built." Um, what? That sounds like some harsh criticism right there! I mean, sure, the game might not be perfect, but it's not all bad either. Wccftech said it's shallow across all areas and held together by an average narrative - yikes!

But hey, at the end of the day (or should I say, the Settlers' franchise?), what matters is how you feel while playing this game. And for me, that was... well, let's just say I didn't exactly get the warm fuzzies.

So if you're a die-hard Settlers fan or just looking for something to pass the time while you're sipping that cup of tea with your grandma, The Settlers: New Allies might be worth checking out. But don't go in expecting too much - it's not going to win any awards for originality.

And hey, at least it's not as bad as those SpazioGames folks said! Hippo Penny out!
